docs.lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration twice declined to approve Bydureon in 2010, with its most serious concern being that the drug might contribute to heart rhythm abnormalities.

headline.seo: Bydureon, a Diabetes Drug from Amylin, Wins F.D.A. Approval
headline.main: Diabetes Drug Injected Weekly Wins F.D.A. Approval
headline.print_headline: Diabetes Drug Injected Weekly Wins F.D.A. Approval

docs.abstract: Food and Drug Administration approves Amylin Pharmaceuticals' new drug Bydureon for Type 2 diabetes, ending years of setbacks; drug is injected once a week.
docs.snippet: The Food and Drug Administration twice declined to approve Bydureon in 2010, with its most serious concern being that the drug might contribute to heart rhythm abnormalities.

docs.lead_paragraph: A proposed change to depression’s definition could greatly expand the number of people treated, a new study says.

headline.seo: Depression’s Criteria May Be Changed to Include Grieving
headline.main: Grief Could Join List of Disorders
headline.print_headline: Grief Could Join List Of Disorders

docs.abstract: Report issued by psychiatric researchers at Columbia and New York Universities argues that a proposed change to the definition of depression would characterize grieving as a disorder and could greatly increase the number of people who are treated unnecessarily for depression; the change has been proposed for the American Psychiatric Association's fifth edition of its Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders.
docs.snippet: A proposed change to depression’s definition could greatly expand the number of people treated, a new study says.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study suggests that dutasteride may slow or stop tumor growth in men who decide against surgery.

headline.seo: Dutasteride Is Seen to Curtail Cancer Left in Prostate
headline.main: Drug Seen to Curtail Cancer Left in Prostate
headline.print_headline: Drug Seen To Curtail Cancer Left In Prostate

docs.abstract: Limited study led by Neil E Fleshner and published in journal The Lancet finds evidence that prostate-shrinking drug dutasteride may also slow or stop the growth of prostate cancers.
docs.snippet: A study suggests that dutasteride may slow or stop tumor growth in men who decide against surgery.

docs.lead_paragraph: I admit to being jealous of my sons for growing up in a time when vaccines spared them miseries like the measles, mumps and polio scares that marred my childhood. But I'm most envious of their freedom from the dental decay that forced me to spend countless miserable hours with my mouth propped open while the dentist did his best to stay on top of rapidly rotting teeth. By my mid-20s, I had already lost one molar and all four wisdom teeth, and every remaining molar had been restored with fillings.

headline.main: Personal Health: Dental Exam Went Well? Thank Fluoride

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column details the benefits of water fluoridation for dental health, along with the unfounded controversy that has hounded it for decades. Drawing (M)

headline.print_headline: Personal Health: Dental Exam Went Well? Thank Fluoride

docs.abstract: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention calls fluoridation one of the 10 most valuable public health measures of the 20th century.

headline.main: Iodide Heart Scans Linked to Thyroid Disease

docs.abstract: A common iodide contrast agent given to millions of patients who undergo medical scans every year raises the risk of thyroid disease, a new study shows.
docs.snippet: A common iodide contrast agent given to millions of patients who undergo medical scans every year raises the risk of thyroid disease, a new study shows.
